I'd highly recommend "Looper" for you! It's a thrilling science fiction film set in 2074 where assassins like Joe are sent targets from the future, but things take a surprising turn when one of those targets is his future self. The movie features an excellent performance by Bruce Willis and Joseph Gordon-Levitt.

If you're up for something entirely different, "Man on Wire" might also interest you. It's a captivating documentary about Philippe Petit's daring high-wire walk between the Twin Towers in 1974.

On the other hand, if you prefer something more dramatic and thought-provoking, "Zero Dark Thirty" might be right up your alley. It chronicles the decade-long hunt for Osama bin Laden and offers a riveting portrayal of real events, starring notable actors like Jessica Chastain and Chris Pratt. Enjoy the movies!

I'd highly recommend "300" for you. This epic film takes place in ancient Greece, where King Leonidas and 300 Spartans bravely fight against a vast Persian army led by King Xerxes. The movie features gripping battles and powerful performances by actors like Gerard Butler and Michael Fassbender.

If you're looking for something slightly different but still enjoyable, "Jack Reacher" might be worth checking out as well. It stars Tom Cruise as a former military policeman who investigates a mass shooting and uncovers a web of deceit and corruption. The movie combines suspenseful plot twists with Cruise's action-packed performance.

In Hotel Transylvania, Dracula runs a high-end resort for monsters and goes into overprotective mode when a boy discovers the resort. Starring Adam Sandler, this animated film offers a fun twist on classic monster lore. On the other hand, "Lincoln" is a historical drama that follows President Abraham Lincoln's struggles during the Civil War, including his decision to emancipate the slaves. This movie features an impressive cast, including Joseph Gordon-Levitt and Hal Holbrook. Both films offer engaging stories with different tones, so I hope one of these recommendations piques your interest!

It seems like you're interested in thought-provoking stories set during war times, and fortunately, I have a couple of recommendations from the list you provided that might intrigue you.

Firstly, "Wreck-It Ralph" is an animated film with a unique twist on the war genre, as it takes place within the world of video games rather than historical conflicts. It's a fun and heartwarming story about a villain seeking to be a hero.

If you prefer more traditional war stories, "The Wind That Shakes the Barley" offers an immersive portrayal of the Irish War of Independence, with beautiful cinematography and powerful performances. Both films are engaging and thought-provoking in their own ways! Enjoy your movie time!
